Description: Coarse ware pottery bowl; large chip from rim and about one fifth of rim missing; large sherd with about one third of rim re-attached; broad mouth with small everted rim; tall neck and broad deep body with rounded shoulder; broad ring foot; pronounced knife-smoothing/burnishing on most of body; grey clay with red-brown exterior, partly burnished; abundant very fine mica and frequent medium-coarse grits and quartz.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, Findspot 51, domestic buildings in the urban area to the east of the Saite enclosure (so-called "Camp").
Curator's comments: Findspot from Petrie 1888, p. 60 § 57, p. 61 § 58, pl. xxiv, 13
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 60 § 57, p. 61 § 58, pl. xxiv, 13)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.44, p.93, p.98, p.100, p.189, pl.31, p.213)
